p: The essential oil of O. basilicum was principally composed by the aromatic ether Estragol (74.0%) and the terpene with alcohol group Linalool (17.8%), which are known to have repellent and toxic activities against stored product insect [ 42]. The proportion of main components obtained in O. basilicum oil, were similar to those described by Kim et al. [ 43] and Souza et al. [ 35]. The genus Ocimum, belonging to the family Lamiaceae, has been investigated with regard to its insecticidal properties against diverse insect pests [ 35, 44, 45, 46].
